alert.note: Alert for Tolland; Windham (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 6:43PM EDT until September 13 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norton has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Tolland County in northern Connecticut... Southern Windham County in northern Connecticut... * Until 945 PM EDT. * At 643 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mansfield, Windham, Plainfield, Willimantic, Killingly, Brooklyn, Canterbury, Pomfret, Chaplin, Hampton, Eastford and Scotland. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
